title: Mind, Brain & Behavior
description: This five-week course will cover neuroanatomy, neurophysiology, neuropharmacology, principles of neurological function, and human growth and development. S/U grades only.

title: Mind, Brain & Behavior II
description: This five-week course during year two covers neurological, psychiatric, ophthalmological, otolaryngological, and general head and neck principles, syndromes, and disorders. Prerequisites: CLIN 227A. S/U grades only.

title: Mind, Brain & Behavior II—Psychiatry Emphasis
description: A five-week intense course with specific emphasis for clinical psychology graduate students. The psychiatry emphasis will examine aspects of psychopathology, including the following disorders: depressive, psychotic, alcohol and drug personality, suicide, anxiety, obsessive-compulsive, gender dysphoria, sexual dysfunctions, child psychiatry, and sleep-wake among others. S/U grades only.

title: Proseminar in Neuropsychology
description: Yearlong course (CLIN 294A, B, C), each for three credits, offered sequentially fall, winter, and spring. Provides a fundamental knowledge of brain-behavior relationships as well as strategies and methods of neuropsychological assessment and rehabilitation.

title: Independent Study
description: Independent survey of basic concepts in clinical psychology using various sources of material, including scientific papers in clinical psychology and behavioral science and other sources as seem indicated.
